title: Making calls and managing contacts
content:
# Phone App Guide

## Navigation
- **Bottom Navigation Bar**: Switch between **Dial** (keypad & recent calls), **Contacts** (address book), and **Favorites** (speed dial).
- **Alphabet Index**: In the Contacts tab, use the vertical **A-Z scroll bar** on the right edge to quickly jump to names starting with a specific letter.
- **Menu**: Access call history management or settings via the **Three-dot menu** in the top-right corner.

## Search
- **Contact Search**: Tap the **Magnifying Glass icon** at the top of the Contacts or Dial screen to find people by name or number.
- **Search Bar**: A dedicated "Search contacts" bar appears when the search function is active.

## Common Actions
- **Make a Call**: On the Dial screen, enter a number or select a recent contact. Tap the green **SIM 1** or **SIM 2** button to initiate the call on your preferred line.
- **Add Contact**: Go to the **Contacts** tab and tap the large **Plus (+)** floating button at the bottom right to create a new entry.
- **Check History**: The "Dial" home screen lists recent calls with details like Name, Time (e.g., "10:40 PM"), and the SIM used.
- **Organize Groups**: Use the **"Groups"** folder at the top of the contact list to categorize people (e.g., Family, Work).

## Tips
- **Dual SIM Support**: The keypad clearly offers distinct call buttons for **SIM 1** and **SIM 2**, preventing accidental calls from the wrong number.
- **Call Indicators**: Recent calls display small icons (like arrows) and SIM badges (e.g., "2") to help you identify incoming vs. outgoing calls and which line was active.
